infoBoxTitle: Important notes on the example calculation
infoBoxText: The results are non-binding examples and do not replace individual financial advice. Interest rate changes, additional costs and personal circumstances may significantly change the actual payment.
disclaimer: All information is supplied without guarantee and does not represent a legally binding offer. For a binding mortgage offer, please contact your bank, a loan broker or an independent financial advisor.

intro.title: Realistic overview instead of rough guesswork
intro.text: In Germany, interest rate, initial repayment, equity and fixed-interest period are key. Our calculator gives you a better feeling for your potential monthly payment before you speak to banks or advisors.
bullets: Quick overview of a sample monthly payment based on your input.
Better position when negotiating with banks or independent financial advisors.
Understand how equity, interest rate and term influence your monthly payment.

calculator.title: Your financing data
calculator.subtitle: Adjust the values and see instantly how the sample monthly payment changes.

form.priceHint: Total purchase price incl. land (excluding closing costs).
form.downPaymentHint: Amount you can contribute from your own funds.
form.interestHint: Typical values, depending on the market, might be in the range of ~2–5%.
form.yearsHint: The sample annuity is calculated as if it stayed constant over this period.
form.repaymentRateHint: For German mortgages, an initial repayment of e.g. 2–3% is common. This value here is for orientation only.

results.loanAmountHint: Purchase price minus equity (excluding taxes and closing costs such as notary, land registry, etc.).
results.monthlyRateHint: Non-binding example for interest plus repayment.
results.year1InterestHint: Approximate interest payments in the first year (simplified).
results.year1RepaymentHint: Part of your annual payment that actually reduces the loan.
results.totalPayment: Total payments over the selected term
results.totalPaymentHint: Interest + repayment over the selected period (simplified assumption with constant payment).

legal.title: Legal basics in Germany (short overview)
legal.text1: In Germany, residential consumer mortgages are regulated mainly by the German Civil Code (BGB) and the implementation of the EU Mortgage Credit Directive. Lenders must assess creditworthiness and provide comprehensive information and advice.
legal.text2: Typical cost components include interest, repayment, possible commitment interest, special repayment options and additional closing costs (real estate transfer tax, notary, land registry, etc.). These are not included in this calculator.
points: Residential consumer mortgages are subject to strict advisory and information requirements.
A loan may only be granted if repayment appears highly likely based on your financial situation.
Effective annual interest rate, total cost and fixed-interest period must be disclosed transparently.
Independent advice can help you compare offers from different banks.
legal.note: This section does not replace legal or financial advice. Binding information is only provided by your bank, financial institution or a licensed advisor.
